critique: This document pertains to the Emergency Relief Appropriation Acts of 1935 and 1936 and amends Regulation No. 7 regarding the employment of youth on projects under the National Youth Administration and the Works Progress Administration. It sets guidelines for working hours, conditions of employment, and monthly earnings for young persons, capping part-time earnings at 50% of the schedule outlined in Executive Order No. 7046. The document reflects the government's intervention in the economy during the Great Depression to provide employment opportunities for young people. It does not directly address immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. However, it does represent a moderate level of economic regulation and a slight tilt towards liberal policies due to its focus on social welfare and government intervention in the economy to alleviate unemployment.
